answers.answer: Hi.Have you got blood sugar tested ? Do you have diabetes ? Diabetic neuropathy is a common cause for such symptoms.To find out if you have neuropathy, you will need to consult a Neurologist and do a never conduction study.Another possibility is that you re having deficiencies of minerals in blood. You can get it checked.Regards

question: I am not sure what is wrong with me, I think it could possibly have to do with my brain, nerve damage,centeral nervous system? I have been going numb in my toes, thumb, fingers, and tounge. The numbness comes and goes. I was also diagnosed with Achalasia( LES closed, possible nerve damage). I now eat through a feeding tube because of the Achalasia(3unsucessful surgeries) I do not know if these are all related or not. I aso have low blood pressure which causes my arms and legs to fall asleep at night and I become faintwhen standing up quickly.
title: Nerve Damage/ or what?
